level.heading: Prohibition on use of expanded polystyrene food service products.

level.text: By January 1, 2016, no food service business shall sell or provide food in expanded polystyrene food service products, regardless of where the food will be consumed.

Subsection (a) of this section shall not apply to food or beverages that were filled and sealed in expanded polystyrene containers before a food service business received them or to materials used to package raw, uncooked, or butchered meat, fish, poultry, or seafood for off- premises consumption.

level.heading: Editor’s notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 20-142: Section 502(f) of D.C. Law 20-142 provided that §§ 401, 402, and 406 of the act shall apply as of December 17, 2014.
